name: identitytoolkit_relyingparty_getOobConfirmationCode
description: Get a code for user action confirmation.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: An opaque string that represents a user for quota purposes. Must not exceed 40 characters.

Relyingparty.description: Request of getting a code for user confirmation (reset password, change email etc.)

androidInstallApp.description: whether or not to install the android app on the device where the link is opened

androidMinimumVersion.description: minimum version of the app. if the version on the device is lower than this version then the user is taken to the play store to upgrade the app

androidPackageName.description: android package name of the android app to handle the action code

canHandleCodeInApp.description: whether or not the app can handle the oob code without first going to web

captchaResp.description: The recaptcha response from the user.

challenge.description: The recaptcha challenge presented to the user.

continueUrl.description: The url to continue to the Gitkit app

iOSAppStoreId.description: iOS app store id to download the app if it's not already installed

iOSBundleId.description: the iOS bundle id of iOS app to handle the action code

idToken.description: The user's Gitkit login token for email change.

newEmail.description: The new email if the code is for email change.

userIp.description: The IP address of the user.

$block: Response of getting a code for user confirmation (reset password, change email etc.).

$ul: **email**: The email address that the email is sent to.
**oobCode**: The code to be send to the user.
